SENT.plain: BehÃ§et's disease (BD) is a chronic relapsing multisystem disease characterized by oral ulceration, genital ulceration and ocular lesions
Gastrointestinal involvement is rare, often difficult to treat and associated with a high mortality rate

We treated a 47-year-old Korean man with BD who had a recurrent intestinal ulcer with tumor necrosis factor alpha antibody (infliximab); he initially underwent right hemicolectomy due to uncontrolled intestinal bleeding
For patients with intestinal BD who fail to respond to conventional treatment, infliximab may be a safe and effective new therapeutic option
